text: What is AMPscript in Salesforce Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A proprietary scripting language from Salesforce used to personalize content in emails, web pages, and SMS within Marketing Cloud.
A tool to automate email campaigns on any marketing platform.
A specific module for managing analytics in Marketing Cloud.
The standard language for creating landing pages in any CRM.

text: What is the difference between AMPscript and SSJS in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: There is no difference, they are two names for the same language.
AMPscript is a proprietary Salesforce language and is processed in real-time, while SSJS is a JavaScript implementation that is processed on the server before sending the content.
SSJS only works in emails and AMPscript only works on web pages.
AMPscript is for junior developers and SSJS is for experts.

text: What are Data Extensions in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Relational tables similar to SQL tables that store data for use in Marketing Cloud.
Advanced AMPscript functions to extend data.
A method to connect Marketing Cloud with external databases.
Custom reports on subscriber activity.

text: What is the function of the %%[ ]%% tag in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Delimiting AMPscript code blocks in emails and web pages for processing.
Indicating to the system to ignore that content during sending.
Dynamically inserting images into emails.
Creating global variables usable throughout the platform.

text: What is Journey Builder in Salesforce Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A tool for designing email templates.
A system for managing subscriber lists.
A visual tool that allows you to create automated multi-channel customer experiences based on events and data.
A system for visualizing the historical journey of customers.

text: How do you access data from a Data Extension using AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Using only the DataExtension() function.
With functions like Lookup(), LookupRows(), LookupOrderedRows() or LookupRowsCS().
Only through the Content Builder user interface.
Using exclusively SQL Query Activity.

text: What is Content Builder in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A tool for managing CRM integrations.
An email campaign analysis system.
A centralized tool for creating, managing, and delivering content in Marketing Cloud.
An exclusive editor for HTML code.

text: How are variables handled in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Using the $ sign as a prefix for all variables.
They are declared with SET @variableName = value and accessed using @ as a prefix.
You cannot create variables in AMPscript, only use existing data.
Using let or var as in standard JavaScript.

text: What is Automation Studio in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: A tool for creating responsive design templates.
A tool for creating, managing, and executing automated marketing activities that can include data imports, segmentations, sends, and more.
An advanced editor exclusively for AMPscript.
A system for scheduling email sends only.

text: What is the ContentBlockByID() function in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: A function that only allows displaying images saved in Content Builder.
A function that allows you to insert content from a specific Content Block using its ID as a reference.
A function for dynamically creating new content blocks.
A tool for updating existing content in the database.

text: What is the main difference between Script.Util.HttpRequest in SSJS and using HTTPGet() in AMPscript?

possibleAnswers.text: Script.Util.HttpRequest in SSJS offers more configuration options and greater flexibility for complex API calls, while HTTPGet() in AMPscript is simpler but more limited.
There is no functional difference between the two.
HTTPGet() is faster and always preferable.
Script.Util.HttpRequest only works in CloudPages.

text: What are CloudPages in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: Campaign report pages for clients.
Web pages hosted in Marketing Cloud that can use AMPscript, SSJS, and other platform functionalities.
An exclusive system for storing images in the cloud.
The old name for Content Builder.

text: What are Salesforce Data Extensions and how do they relate to Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: They are generic data tables with no relation to Salesforce CRM.
They are special Data Extensions that automatically synchronize data between Salesforce CRM and Marketing Cloud using Marketing Cloud Connect.
They are predefined templates for email campaigns.
They are code extensions to customize the user interface.

text: How is the try-catch structure used in SSJS?

possibleAnswers.text: SSJS does not support try-catch exception handling.
It only works with database errors.
It is used as in standard JavaScript: try { code that may fail } catch(error) { error handling }, allowing you to capture and manage errors elegantly.
It requires a special license for use in Marketing Cloud.

text: What advantages does using SSJS offer over AMPscript in Marketing Cloud?

possibleAnswers.text: SSJS always executes faster than AMPscript.

SSJS offers a familiar syntax for those who know JavaScript, support for arrays and complex objects, and access to additional APIs such as Platform and Core to interact with Marketing Cloud components.
SSJS is compatible with all browsers without limitations.
SSJS allows sending emails without the need for Journey Builder.
